reviewText: I am 19 years old and a HUGE Johnny Depp fan, but I had never heard of 21 Jump Street until a couple of years ago.  Of course, as soon as it was released, I HAD to own it.I LOVE this show!  It reminds me of Degrassi, as far as the issues it tackles, except it adds undercover cops to the mix.  It makes me wish I had been a teenager in the 80s...all those great hairstyles...Anyway, I really enjoy it.  It's educational, yet entertaining.  Each story is very realistic, and I think it's important for younger people to watch.  Johnny Depp (as Hanson) is just downright adorable, and Peter DeLuise (as Penhall)is really hilarious!  It gets even better when Captain Fuller joins the crew.  "Don't Pet the Teacher" is my favorite episode...(Hanson falls for his teacher).  Any fan of the 80s, Johnny Depp, Peter DeLuise, undercover cops, crime-fighting/solving, or tight jeans :) will enjoy this TV show.Alright, now...as far as the music goes: BOO HOO, people!!!  I know that I can't really relate to the people who are complaining about the music being changed (since I never saw the original show when it first came out), but seriously, what is the big deal?  Since when is music the main concern of a TV show?  It is still a great show.  I'm just thankful they came out with the DVDs at all!  You should be too!
summary: Forget about the music, be happy the DVDs came out at all!!!

reviewText: For joy at the release of this much anticipated dvd!  I was so excited to find out that my all-time favorite tv series (when I was a teen...*cough...some years ago) was finally being released on dvd.  I enjoyed re-visiting the old cast, starring a much younger yet still HOT, Johnny Depp, with my daughters...but the music was horrible!  I mean, in all honesty, I don't recall much of the music from the original airing of the show but it's clear that the music was replaced (Thank God the title song was untouched!!!) by....what is that noise?  If I wasn't such a huge fan of the series, the music would have ruined this otherwise great dvd for me.Nevertheless, if you can grit your teeth through the horrible soundtrack - it's well worth the buy!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love this show, and the story was pretty much the after school saccharine special that I remembered it to be.It's hard to believe that this DVD was released by a television studio; if I didn't know better, I would swear it was released by some guy in Taiwan who burned the show onto DVD from the VHS tapes he's recorded in his Mom's basement.  The transfer is horrible, looks just like it did years ago on a CRT television. Is it possible that they transferred the show to DVD directly from the VHS? They also did a horrible job of editing.  The commercial breaks are poorly done, cutting the shot too soon or sometimes not soon enough. Also, there is some language editing done. You can clearly see that the swear words the character's mouth is making is not the same thing your ears hear.But the TV show...it's great. It's everything that was wonderful about the 80s.

Title: N/A

reviewText: 21 Jump Street was and remains a wonderful series.  I remember as a young boy gleefully watching almost ever one of these episodes on the Fox network.  This show and the Simpsons made me fall in love with the Fox network, at the time, the joke of the network community.  21 Jump Street's actors are all still around today, a testament to how well the acting was.  The mature material made me feel like I was watching an important show, rather than mindless dribble.  Few are more dissapointed with the problems with this DVD than I.Unfortunately, the music has been changed due to licensing roadblocks.  As far as I am concerned, this is a dealbreaker plain and simple.  Then there is the talk of the pilot being the wrong one.  Why?  It makes you realize that whoever was in charge of this DVD release at Anchor Bay wasn't a true 21 Jump Street Fan.  Too bad.The rumors are going around that Miami Vice has succumbed to the same music licensing problems, another dealbreaker.I'm so glad we can all report the truth about these DVD screw ups here at Amazon.com.  I'd give it zero stars if I could, as we are not getting the original material.  Maybe Anchor Bay should have spent the money to get this right, b/c in the end, less people will buy this DVD as a result.
summary: Thank God for the truth and Amazon's reviews
Title: N/A

reviewText: 21 Jump Street launched two careers: one, most notably that of Johnny Depp and the other would be that of the young upstart TV network called Fox. It premiered in 1987 and was, in a way, a 1980's version of the mod squad. But it was original in storylines and ahead of its time in storylines as well. The storylines were dark and gritty as was the subject matter that fueld the episodes back then. There were topical issues touched upon on this series such as AIDS, death, rape, even incest and abuse. But despite those subject matters the series had many great comical aspects to it as well due to the fact that the cast through seasons 1-4 had great chemistry. Two people on the series that had the best chemistry were probably Johnny Depp and Peter DeLuise and that shown through when their characters "Hanson" and "Penhall" donned the alias' of "The McQuaid Brothers" in episodes where their characters had to go undercover in high schools.The series ran strong for 4 seasons as a first run show, but during his last season (season 4) it was well known that Johnny Depp wanted out of his contract to move on to bigger and better things, and he also disliked the concept of cops going undercover in high schools and had some sort of moral objections. Season 5 is easily forgettable as Johnny Depp and Dustin Nguyen had left the show and the ratings dropped drastically so the show was put into syndication. So that was pretty much the death of the show as it became a shell of its former self.Another thing about this series, though it was a show about young officers that looked young and were able to go undercover in high schools, in actuality a lot of the episodes didn't even revolve around that type of scenerio. As the series progressed and characters had developed personalities a lot of episodes revolved around their own struggles on the show most notably the episode about the death of Johnny Depp's character's girlfriend and his character's struggles with the death, and also Peter Deluise's character's struggles in the later seasons involving his wife in El Salvador.It's great to see this series finally be put out on DVD and despite being a show from the late 80's the only thing dated about the show would just be the fashion of the time. The episodes and topic matter still hold up I believe. One other thing about the show was it's choice of great late 80's music, as REM and U2 songs were featured in episodes along with a handful of other songs from hit bands of the time, hopefully the songs featured in episodes will be kept on the DVDs as they are released. One also has to wonder if season 5 will even be released.. Time will tell. And though shows like Married with Children and The Simpsons helped Fox become a major player, this show did help a lot as well by drawing in a young teenage demographic and helped shape Fox into a "hip" and "edgy" network.
Title: N/A

reviewText: OK, AFTER purchasing this set, I read some of the reviews and was saddened to read that the music that was featured in the original run had been changed.  Was I upset?  Yes.  Horrified? Yes.  I grew up watching the original on FOX, but my memory doesn't serve me well in regards to the changing of the music.  I would have never knew it if I hadn't read the reviews.  In saying this, I HOPE in all HOPE that the complete originals one day get released, but for now I am more than satisfied with what I purchased.  If you are nostalgic like I am, this set is the closest thing to perfect you will receive up til now.  Who knows.  The originals may never get released.  If you no longer have your original VHS recordings or you never bothered recording them, buy the set.  You will regret it if you don't.  With the rarity of this show, this is the one time you should 'settle' and not be picky.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have been waiting YEARS for Sliders and 21 Jump Street to come to DVD. I can't believe my dream came true.  This show was so innovative for its time. The stories were riviting, dark, real and heartfelt.  This was one show that dealt with everything from incest, murder, and the dark, real life of runaways living on the street.  They didn't pretend that horrible things didn't happen -- they showed that they did and that everything didn't end happily at the end of an hour.  The best show of the 80's, and possibly a cult fav.A reviewer said that the shows look cheesy because they're from the 80's. Nonsense.  Almost 20 years later I can still sit down and watch an episode of 21 Jump Street and still be as captivated as I was in 1985.  A phenemonal show that deserves the reconigition of being on DVD and seen by a whole new audience, not to mention let us twentysomethings 'remember when'  Thank god for DVD! I love this show, and this price boggles the mind. I can't wait to receive it. No one will be disappointed.  Extras or not, just to have the episodes -- which are never re-run anywhere (if you have them on VHS you were smart to tape)  What a wonderful thing for me to find while searching Amazon. comI'm thrilled! Nothing else on DVD can top this for me.

reviewText: 21 Jumpstreet is the coolest cop show ever.  Even though the music is different. I would rather not have to pay the extra $40 bucks and get to see this great show again.  To tell you the truth it's been so long that I can't remember the music from the show that well  anyway.  And yes, I'm old enough to remember (I was in college when this show started). I'm really enjoying watching Johnny Depp and Peter DeLuise again.  They were great together on this show.  21 Jump Street was so much more than the music.  Get over it and enjoy this great show! I love it!

reviewText: Seeing 21 Jump Street again after so many years was a true guilty pleasure, mainly because of my obsession with Johnny Depp and revisiting the show that cast him to international fame. But seeing the series also reminded me of the talents of the other actors, and how cool all the undercover cops were ... and how positively outrageous hairstyles were back then.Way back when, the series was the first of its kind to address the problems teenagers face at home and at school. To my mind, it started a whole host of important research into the teen's brain which it has been shown is completely different from that of a child or an adult. It is no wonder, then, that high school is the place for experimenting and a real hub of what may seem like incomprehensible behaviours and attitudes.I've often thought that the series deserves to be re-invented for the modern young audience. With a little bit of updating on the rising problems in schools, it could become as popular now as it was then. And, of course, may prove to be a launching pad for upcoming actors.Many reviewers complain that the music has totally changed --- I must be very honest here to say that I did not notice (I did, however, think that the music was a little strange - others obviously have much better long-term memories than I do!). It was enough for me to get absorbed with Johnny Depp and with perfect hindsight be able to see his obvious talent for acting, and his exploration of the strange and wonderful.I've read that Depp hated being a teen star, but in all honesty he should be proud of what 21 Jump Street achieved and its continuing popularity. Not to mention that it helped his future career.My advice is to take it for what it is, and enjoy the guilty pleasure of watching episode after episode regardless of whether it rains or shines.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Ok, up front, I am an intense Johnny Depp fan. With that said, should I actually write anything else? Probably not but I will anyway.The series is as poignant today as it was in the late 80's. If Hollie Robinson's hair could be tamed down a bit and Frederick Forrest's hippie talk was toned down a bit, it could probably play pretty well today. Themes around teenage prostitution, drug dealing and using, pregnancy, the whole gamut of teen issues are covered in the series. It's not as sexual or violent as today's teen shows. It's much less sophisticated, but just as meaningful. And then there is Johnny Depp. Baby faced and clean cut, he just can't make it as a beat cop. No one takes him seriously! This is an exceptional opportunity to allow him to portray any number of characters as an undercover cop.This is only the first season. It will be interesting to see how he develops as an actor through the rest of the series.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is listed as the "Complete first season". This is a blatant lie. There is noting "complete" about these DVDs. The episodes have been butchered.As many have noted, copyright madness lead to all of the music in the episodes (except for the theme song) being replaced. To be honest, I don't remember the music in any of the original episodes, however it's painfully obvious that the new music doesn't belong in the episodes. It's not even a question of whether the new songs are appropriate for any given scene. The replaced songs are too loud and almost completely drown out the sound effects during montage sequences. Other times, they don't sound right when mixed with the dialog. Whatever process was used to force the new music into the episodes, it has all the subtlety of a sledgehammer.Then there are the missing scenes. Apparently these were made from the syndicated versions which were edited to allow for more commercial time, rather than the original Fox versions.After seeing what a crappy job they did, I'd sooner buy a bootleg copy made from 20+ year old VHS tapes, than spend any money on this travesty.

reviewText: I remember being a teen when this show aired. The opening theme was engraved in my head, and the 2 part pilot remained a topic of discussion among friends for quite some time. The characters never disappointed the young hearts, and the show remains in my memories even to this day.With the release of this DVD, I'm hoping teens in this day will find the same excitement as we did back then. One of my favorite episodes was when Johnny Depp went undercover into a juvenile prison and became the "hammer." This show is highly recommended.

Title: N/A

reviewText: I was thrilled when they decided to make the dvd available to the public. I watched the show when it first was on the Fox network and surprisingly enough, instead of it being a "teeny bopper" sort of show, I found it to be done extremely well. The acting as well as the characters and the storylines were excellent. I started to tape it on vhs and I'm glad I did. I noticed in some of the episodes, some small scenes were cut. The ending to the second part of the pilot where Hanson comes to Captain Jenko's garage to play in his band, Jenko and his band members were already playing their music. They completely cut the song out of the dvd and just cut to Hanson coming to the garage. Also in the original, Hanson plays his sax with the band and then the credits start to roll. On the dvd, he is about to play, and that gets cut too. Some of the words used in the dialogue were dubbed over which was kind of ridiculous considering the show started in 1987 and nothing was dubbed over then. You can read their lips and know what they're really saying. Also the music was changed. Not a good idea. But all that aside, the show on dvd is just as good today as it was then. All of the characters were diverse and interesting. In spite of some of the negativity, it was an excellent show and very much worth it to see.
